name: Asthma
description: A respiratory condition causing difficulty in breathing due to inflamed airways.

name: Anemia
description: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells, leading to fatigue and weakness.

name: Common Cold
description: A viral infection of the nose and throat causing a runny nose, sneezing, and cough.

name: Flu (Influenza)
description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing headaches and nasal congestion.

name: Bronchitis
description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to cough and mucus production.

name: Gastroenteritis
description: An intestinal infection causing diarrhea, cramps, nausea, and vomiting.

name: Ear Infection
description: An infection in the ear, often causing pain and fever.

name: Strep Throat
description: A bacterial infection that causes sore throat and fever.

name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva, leading to redness and discharge from the eye.

name: Food Poisoning
description: Illness caused by consuming contaminated food, leading to nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.

name: Allergic Rhinitis
description: An allergic reaction causing sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes.

name: Sprains
description: Injury to ligaments caused by stretching or tearing, often occurring in the ankle or wrist.

name: Migraine
description: A severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light.

name: Chickenpox
description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash and red spots.

name: Fungal Skin Infection
description: Infections like athlete's foot or ringworm caused by fungi on the skin.

name: UTI (Urinary Tract Infection)
description: An infection in the urinary system, causing pain and frequent urination.

name: Cystitis
description: Inflammation of the bladder, often causing pain and a burning sensation during urination.

name: Hives
description: An outbreak of swollen, pale red bumps or plaques on the skin due to an allergic reaction.

name: RSV (Respiratory Syncytial Virus)
description: A virus that causes respiratory infections, particularly in infants and young children.

name: Otitis Media
description: Middle ear infection causing earache, fever, and trouble hearing.

name: Impetigo
description: A contagious skin infection that causes red sores, usually on the face.

name: Scabies
description: A skin infestation caused by tiny mites, leading to itching and rash.

name: Laryngitis
description: Inflammation of the larynx causing a hoarse voice and sore throat.

name: Stomach Ulcer
description: A sore that develops on the lining of the stomach, causing pain and indigestion.

name: Dehydration
description: A condition caused by the excessive loss of body fluids, leading to weakness and dizziness.

name: Bacterial Vaginosis
description: An infection caused by an imbalance of bacteria in the vagina.

name: Shingles
description: A viral infection causing a painful rash, usually on one side of the body.

name: Cold Sores
description: Small blisters around the mouth caused by the herpes simplex virus.

name: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease
description: A viral illness causing sores in the mouth and rashes on the hands and feet.

name: Hemorrhoids
description: Swollen veins in the rectum or anus causing discomfort and bleeding.

name: Diarrhea
description: Frequent loose or watery bowel movements, often caused by infections or food intolerance.

name: Constipation
description: Difficulty in passing stools, often accompanied by abdominal pain.

name: Psoriasis
description: A skin disorder that causes red, scaly patches on the skin.

name: Bursitis
description: Inflammation of the bursa, causing pain in joints such as the shoulder or hip.

name: Tendonitis
description: Inflammation of a tendon, often caused by overuse or injury.

name: Sinus Headache
description: A headache caused by inflamed sinuses, leading to pressure and pain in the face.

name: Boils
description: A painful, pus-filled bump caused by bacterial infection of a hair follicle.

name: Vertigo
description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness, often caused by inner ear problems.

name: Dandruff
description: A condition causing flaking of the scalp, often accompanied by itching.

name: Chilblains
description: Painful, itchy swellings on the skin due to exposure to cold temperatures.

name: Heat Rash
description: A skin irritation caused by excessive sweating in hot and humid conditions.

name: Sore Throat
description: Pain or irritation in the throat, often due to viral or bacterial infections.

name: Ingrown Toenail
description: A condition where the edge of the toenail grows into the surrounding skin, causing pain and swelling.

name: Blisters
description: Fluid-filled pockets on the skin, often caused by friction or burns.

name: Jock Itch
description: A fungal infection in the groin area causing itching and redness.

name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
description: A condition characterized by extreme fatigue that doesn't improve with rest.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints, causing pain and inflammation.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: A disorder of the central nervous system that affects movement, often including tremors.

name: Narcolepsy
description: A sleep disorder characterized by excessive daytime sleepiness and sudden attacks of sleep.

name: Osteoporosis
description: A condition in which bones become weak and brittle.

name: Lupus
description: An autoimmune disease that can cause inflammation, pain, and damage to various parts of the body.

name: Celiac Disease
description: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

name: Hypothyroidism
description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.

name: Hyperthyroidism
description: An overactive thyroid that leads to accelerated metabolism, weight loss, and rapid heartbeat.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive neurological disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.

name: Multiple Sclerosis
description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.

name: Crohn's Disease
description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.

name: Endometriosis
description: A condition in which tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside the uterus.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that obstructs airflow from the lungs.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition where the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder where brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures.

name: Eczema
description: A condition that makes the skin red, inflamed, and itchy.

name: Scoliosis
description: A sideways curvature of the spine that occurs most often during the growth spurt before puberty.

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

name: Glaucoma
description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, leading to vision loss.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.

name: Mononucleosis
description: An infectious illness typically caused by the Epstein-Barr virus, resulting in fever and swollen lymph nodes.

name: Tonsillitis
description: Inflammation of the tonsils, typically due to infection.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.

name: Sciatica
description: Pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg, caused by compression of a spinal nerve root.

name: Varicose Veins
description: Swollen, twisted veins that usually occur in the legs and can cause pain.

name: Kidney Stones
description: Hard deposits of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.

name: Ulcerative Colitis
description: A chronic, inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.

name: Cystic Fibrosis
description: A hereditary disorder affecting the exocrine glands, causing the production of abnormally thick mucus.

name: Rosacea
description: A condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in the face.

name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
description: A condition caused by compression of the median nerve as it travels through the wrist at the carpal tunnel.

name: Lyme Disease
description: An infectious disease caused by the bacterium Borrelia transmitted by tick bites.

name: Atrial Fibrillation
description: A heart condition that causes an irregular and often abnormally fast heart rate.

name: Cataracts
description: A condition in which the lens of the eye becomes progressively opaque, resulting in blurred vision.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: A long-term condition where the kidneys do not work effectively.

name: Dermatitis
description: A general term that describes inflammation of the skin.

name: Emphysema
description: A lung condition that causes shortness of breath, usually as part of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

name: Gallstones
description: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder.

name: Herpes Zoster
description: Also known as shingles, it is a reactivation of the chickenpox virus, causing a painful rash.

name: Hyperlipidemia
description: An abnormally high concentration of fats or lipids in the blood.

name: Macular Degeneration
description: An eye disease that causes vision loss in the center of the field of vision.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: A type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down.

name: Psoriatic Arthritis
description: A form of arthritis that affects some people who have psoriasis.

name: Tinnitus
description: The perception of noise or ringing in the ears.

name: Urticaria
description: Also known as hives, it is a skin rash triggered by a reaction to food, medicine, or other irritants.

name: Cholangitis
description: An inflammation of the bile duct system.

name: Agrens Syndrome
description: An autoimmune disease that affects the glands that produce tears and saliva.

name: Trigeminal Neuralgia
description: A chronic pain condition that affects the trigeminal nerve in the face.

name: Wilson's Disease
description: A rare inherited disorder that causes copper to accumulate in the liver, brain, and other vital organs.

name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
description: An inflammatory disease that can cause the vertebrae to fuse.

name: Bell's Palsy
description: A sudden weakness in the muscles on one half of the face.

name: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
description: A genetic disorder characterized by progressive muscle degeneration and weakness.
